thread.title: Dontay Bassett, 3-star PF, commits to Florida Gators over Oregon State Beavers, Colorado Buffaloes, others
thread.title_full: Dontay Bassett, 3-star PF, commits to Florida Gators over Oregon State Beavers, Colorado Buffaloes, others | OregonLive.com

author: Andrew Nemec | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Dontay Bassett, 3-star PF, commits to Florida Gators over Oregon State Beavers, Colorado Buffaloes, others
text:
The Oregon State Beavers basketball program already has two commitments in the class of 2016 ‚Äì four-star point guard JaQuori McLaughlin and three-star power forward Ben Kone ‚Äì but missed on a third member Monday, as 247Sports three-star power forward Dontay Bassett committed to Florida over fellow finalists Arkansas, Colorado, Nebraska and Oregon State:
I'm proud to say I'm committed to the University of Florida üêäüèÄ
‚Äî Dontay Bassett (@dontezzy_bo) October 12, 2015
The 6-foot-8, 205-pound big man, out of Oldsmar Christian School (Oldsmar, Florida), said in the end the University of Florida had a home-court advantage that other schools couldn't match.
"As soon as I stepped on campus it felt right with the coaches the players," he said. "It was a great energy and vibe on campus and I knew it was the place."
Also helping the Gators was their aggressive approach to adding Bassett into the fold.
"Florida recruited me a little bit harder before my visit, after my visit," he said. "Florida was active, so was Colorado. Colorado was in my top two."
Despite the Buffaloes winding up in second place, the Florida big man said he liked Oregon State throughout the process and was impressed with the coaching staff.
"I liked the coaching staff," Bassett explained. "I just thought going to Florida was my best opportunity."
After his visit to Corvallis, the power forward was high on the Beavers, but in the end it wasn't enough.
"They showed me the campus a lot. I met all of the staff, academic advisors. Everyone seemed to be on the same page. I liked that," he told The Oregonian . "They all have the same goals and try to reach them. I liked the environment around campus, the support for the community ‚Äì everything. Oregon State was nice."
Oregon State's basketball class is currently ranked No. 42 in the country by 247Sports ‚Äì three spots ahead of Florida ‚Äì but the Beavers intend to more than double the numbers of commitments by signing day.
While Oregon State missed on Bassett, it's clear the program is ready to compete with the nation's top programs on the recruiting trail.
-- Andrew Nemec
anemec@oregonian.com
@ AndrewNemec
